page.title: 07Frith Hill, Deepcut
page.content: The sandy slopes of{Frith Hill}are covered with mixed woodland of Scots Pine, Silver Birch, Oak, Willow, Rowan and Sweet Chestnut. The top of the hill is more open with wide stony paths bordered with Bracken, Gorse and Heather. Wild flowers such as Stitchwort, Ox-eye daisy, Wild Pansy, Thistle, Plantain, Dog Rose, Speedwell and Vetch can be found especially at the northern end of the hill in the disused dump area. There are many squirrels and rabbits, lots of wood ants and plenty of bird life. At the south western end there is a disused reservoir, now overgrown with saplings. The area is very useful for horse and motorbike riding, for jogging and taking your dog for a walk. The army, who own it, train there.
